figure verb
(EXPECT)
B1 [ I ] mainly US to expect or think that something will happen: [ + (that) ] We figured (that) you'd want to rest after your trip.
More examplesFewer examplesHe figured that they would offer the job to someone else.I figure that you'll want to eat before we go out.We figured that the train would be delayed.They figured that there might be a problem with the building work.She figures that she'll be able to save money by cycling to work.
